required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study of TQB2450 Injection Combined With Anlotinib Hydrochloride Capsules Versus Paclitaxel as Weekly Treatment of Relapsed Platinum-resistant Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open, Parallel Controlled Phase III Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of TQB2450 Injection Combined With Androtinib Hydrochloride Capsules Versus Paclitaxel as Weekly Treatment in the Treatment of Recurrent Platinum-resistant Ovarian Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of TQB2450 injection combined with Anlotinib Hydrochloride capsules versus weekly treatment with paclitaxel of recurrent platinum-resistant ovarian cancer.A total of 405 subjects will be enrolled.

primary_outcome.measure: Disease progression-free survival(PFS) evaluated by Independent Review Committee(IRC)
primary_outcome.description: The period from the first use of the drug to disease progression or death (whichever occurs first);

The preriod from the first use of the drug to death from all causes. For subjects who are still alive at the last follow-up, the OS will be counted as data censored based on the last follow-up. For subjects who are lost follow-up, the OS will be counted as data cesored based on the last confirmed survival time before being lost to follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: The period from the first use of the drug to disease progression or death (whichever occurs first)

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS rate of 6 months: including PFS rate of 6 months evaluated by IRC and investigators;
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects reaching 6 months from firstly- recorded objective tumor response (complete remission(CR) or partial remission(PR)) to firstly-recorded objective tumor progression or death due to any cause (whichever occurred first) .

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (ORR) evaluated by IRC and investigators
secondary_outcome.description: , the proportion of subjects whose tumors are evaluated as complete remission(CR) and partial remission(PR) by IRC and investigators. It is recorded from the first use of the drug to disease progression or initiation of a new anticancer treatment.
The period from firstly-recorded objective tumor response (CR or PR) to firstly-recorded objective tumor progression or death due to any cause (whichever occurs first) .
Proportion of subjects whose tumors shrink or remain stable for a certain period, including complete remission（CR）, partial remission（PR） and stable disease（SD）;
The proportion of subjects who survive for 12 months after the first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs)，as well as abnormal laboratory examination indicators.
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of AEs and SAEs recorded afte signing the informed consent form(ICF).

arm_group.description: TQB2450 injection: once every 21 days, 1200mg each time, intravenous infusion. The longest administration time should not exceed 24 months. Anlotinib Hydrochloride capsules: once a day, 12mg each time, oral administration on an empty stomach before breakfast for 2 weeks, withdrawal for 1 week, i.e. 3 weeks (21 days) as a course of treatment.
80mg/m2, intravenous drip, once a week (D1, D8, D15 of 21 days), 21 days as a course of treatment.

intervention.description: Anlotinib Hydrochloride is a multi-target tyrosine kinase inhibitor.
Paclitaxel is a novel anti-microtubule agent.
TQB2450 is a programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1) humanized monoclonal antibody.
